New Records: Finn Allen broke Brendon McCullum's record for the highest individual score by a New Zealander in T20Is with 137 runs.
Finn Allen equalled the record of 16 sixes in an inning previously held only by Afghanistan's Hazratullah Zazai.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen scored 137 runs in only 62 deliveries, including 16 sixes and 5 boundaries in the 3rd T20I.
Pakistan lost both their openers cheaply and never looked like they were in the chase.
Babar Azam made 58 runs in his innings with a strike rate of 156.76.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and opted to field first in the third Twenty20 international against New Zealand.
New Zealand entered the match without the services of Kane Williamson who got injured in the last match and was ruled out of the series.
Post-Match Reflections: With this victory, New Zealand has taken an unassailable lead of 3-0 in the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the University Oval Ground in Dunedin.
Finn Allen smashed Pakistan's speedster Haris Rauf for 27 runs in an over.
Others: Fans from around the world enjoyed the spectacle put on by Finn Allen with his monstrous hitting and expressed their views on it on social media.
